examples.text: Ask if he could have fallen
Ask about the man living alone.
Agree, go back and interrogate the lone walker
Ask to look at the body
Ask for the cause of death
Send Haynes round the windows to look
Ask whether they were near the castle
Ask if any other DNA was found
Disagree - but go to find the lone young man
Ask if he was with anyone
Suggest he fell from the wall
Ask if her partner mentioned anything
Ask for the time of death
Ask if we know who he is
Ask if anything else was found at the scene
Ask if the fall killed him
State he died from blunt force trauma

values.text:
<speak>It's the early hours of the morning: cold wet, and the mud gets everywhere as you trudge through it. <voice name="Geraint">"I see him, he's over there."</voice> Haynes, your partner, says, shining his torch at something in the distance. You can't quite make it out, against the glare of the torch on the walls of Barnard castle. As you approach, a figure comes into view: a man, standing in a yellow raincoat, and something on the ground.
Do you: 
Check the time?
Ask what happened?
Ask who Karl is?
</speak>

<speak>The time is 4:03 AM.
Do you: 
Ask to look at the body?
Search around the body?
</speak>

<speak>You turn your eyes to the ground. There's not much to make out - the mud covers most of it. There might be blood, but it's so covered by the dirt that it all looks the same. The clothing must be dark, and looks like there's a coat and dark trousers. He is at the base of the castle wall, and his limbs are spread out, as if he'd fallen from a height.
Do you: 
Ask for any other remarks?
Ask if he could have fallen?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Now that I think about it, I did hear some shouting for a few minutes after the first noise. Not sure, though." Karl says. The others are arriving now. You need to head back to the station with Haynes. <voice name="Geraint">"Come on, let forensics do their job"</voice></voice>, you say to him.
Do you: 
Head back to the car?
</speak>

<speak>The drive to the station doesn't take long, and Haynes is silent for most of it. You walk up the stairs quickly, and enter your office. [Player]'Alright, so what have we got?' You ask Haynes. He replies, writing on a whiteboard as he speaks: <voice name="Geraint">"So. Profile. Middle-aged. White male. Blond hair, no glasses. Location of death, Barnard castle, on the green. Injury unknown yet. Possible causes of death..."</voice>
Do you: 
Suggest natural causes?
Suggest he fell from the wall?
State he died from blunt force trauma?
</speak>

<speak>Haynes gives you a look, as if to ask if you are serious. Nevertheless, he adds it to the list. <voice name="Geraint">"Right. Any better ideas?"</voice>
Do you: 
Suggest he fell from the wall?
State he died from blunt force trauma?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"I think he was in the right position for it. We'll have to wait for forensics though to confirm though." Haynes replies. You look at the whiteboard. It's not exactly full. <voice name="Geraint">"Well, let's see where we are after interviewing the neighbours. Time?"[Haynes] "6:45 AM". [Player]"Ok, give it a few hours, then we√Ø'll head out."</voice></voice>
Do you: 
Wait for a few hours?
</speak>

<speak>With the sun fully up, there's a lot more people out as you drive through the streets. You stop at a row of houses, just over the road from the castle. [Player"Ok, we'll check these first." You say to Haynes. You get out, and look at the first few houses. Number 13 has a very nicely decorated driveway, plenty of plantlife and a few baskets on the doorstep, but no car. 14 has two hatchbacks, and you can hear talking inside. 15 is not very decorated, and has a sedan outside. 16 has a Ford Focus, and a well-looked after paved driveway. You walk up to number 14 and reach for the doorbell - without warning it opens suddenly, revealing a slightly confused woman . There's a small child behind her, and a middle-aged man at the end of the hallway. <voice name="Geraint">"Can I help you?"  She asks. <voice name="Geraint">"Sorry to disturb. Just a few questions about anything you might have heard last night?".  [Angela]"Uh, sure." The man shepherds the small child back through the hallway. [Player]"Can I take your name?" [Angela]"It's Angela Smith. That's my husband Mark back there, we're just on the school run."</voice></voice>
Do you: 
Ask about hearing a noise?
Ask whether they were near the castle?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Sorry, no. I don't remember hearing anything like that. We were watching a film last night though."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask whether they were near the castle?
Ask if her partner mentioned anything?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Well we do take the kids occasionally. But we haven't actually been in weeks, things have been a bit busy. Sorry, will this take long? I've got to get Charlie to school."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask if her partner mentioned anything?
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"(pauses) No, he didn't hear anything either."</voice>
Do you: 
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Thanks for your time, that's all." You and Haynes walk back onto the street. <voice name="Geraint">"15 looks a bit quiet."</voice></voice> You look at the house; it's certainly not well-kept, and the driveway is far overgrown. You walk up and ring the doorbell. There's no answer.
Do you: 
Try the doorbell again?
Send Haynes round the windows to look?
</speak>

<speak>You try the doorbell again, and knock as well. Still no answer
Do you: 
Ring the doorbell again?
</speak>

<speak>The door suddenly swings open. <voice name="Geraint">"Yes?" An irritated man answers. His hair is black and unkempt, and his eyes are bloodshot. <voice name="Geraint">"Sorry to disturb. We're just wondering if you heard anything last night out of the ordinary." The man looks at you suspiciously.[David]"Er, no. No, I didn't. "</voice></voice> He shifts his feet.
Do you: 
Ask his name?
Ask if he's alright?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"It's David. Heaney. Look, I've got some place I need to be, will this take long?" Haynes interjects - <voice name="Geraint">"Not long, we're just collecting information from everyone on the street. If you wouldn't mind?"</voice></voice> The man seems to relax.
Do you: 
Ask if he's alright?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Yes, I'm fine. Yes, look I really have to go. Sorry." The door closes. Haynes gives you a look. <voice name="Geraint">"We might need to come back to that one. Ok, where's next? Let's check ..." You try and make out the number of the house opposite: [Player]"Number 13". You walk up, knock on the door and wait. There's no answer immediately, but you can see a figure through the frosted glass slowly making their way over. When the door does open, you see an elderly man. [Player]"Sorry to disturb you, sir. We're just checking if the residents of this street heard anything in the early hours of last night." The man chuckles to himself, breaking out into a cough as he does so. <voice name="Geraint">"I'm afraid we won't be of much help to you. Margaret and I didn't stay up past eight last night." [Player]"I see. Can I take your name?" [Peter]"It's Peter Armstrong. That's Margaret, my wife, she's in the living room."</voice></voice></voice>
Do you: 
Ask about the man living alone.?
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak>David looks confused. <voice name="Geraint">"Yes, we don't really know him that well. He only moved here about four months ago. Personally I I'm not too interested; he never says good morning back to us, does he Margaret?" <voice name="Geraint">"He does not."</voice></voice> A voice from the living room says.
Do you: 
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Right. Well I think that's everything. Thanks very much for your time." Your and Haynes close the door and walk back onto the street. You walk up to the house next door and knock. <voice name="Geraint">"Can I help you? I'm round the side." A voice says. You walk around to the alleyway, trying not to crush any flowers. There's a man, on his knees planting in a flowerbed. [Player]"Sorry to interrupt - we're just wondering if you heard anything unusual last night?" [Ernie]"Don't worry, I'm just about done. It's Ernie, by the way." He stands and thinks visibly. [Ernie]"Well, not from my house. But I do like to go for walks sometimes, and I was walking around here and I wasn't sure if I heard something like a bang. It was quite muffled though, I just assumed it was the wind knocking a bin over or something."</voice></voice> Haynes is writing something down.  
Do you: 
Ask where specifically he was?
Ask if he saw anything?
Ask if he was with anyone?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Just near the castle. I didn't go that near, mind you; I was just passing around it."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask if he was with anyone?
Ask if he saw anybody?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Just my own company. There wasn't anyone else around, I quite prefer it like that."</voice>
Do you: 
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"That's really helpful. Thanks for your time, we'll let you get back to the flowers." You and Haynes walk back to the car. <voice name="Geraint">"Well, that was interesting. Doesn't really narrow anything down though." [Player]"Let's check on the forensics, they'll have found something by now." You head back to the station. After arriving, you barely walk in the main entrance before Kathryn, the pathologist, walks up to you. <voice name="Geraint">"There you are. We've done the post-mortem, you can see the results later but it's ready now?" [Player]"Thanks. Let's do it now, anything of note?"</voice></voice></voice> You walk to the examination room; the man is on a table looking not particularly alive.
Do you: 
Ask if the fall killed him?
Ask for the cause of death?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Well, actually, that was pretty easily to rule out. You see, it's quite unlikely that he died from the fall because of the pretty large shotgun wound in his back. And we didn't find any signs that he fell."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask for the time of death?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Some time between two and four in the morning. We can't really narrow it down any more than that."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask if we know who he is?
</speak>

<speak>[Kathryn]"We didn't until about half an hour ago. Someone apparently found a dropped wallet and turned it in, it looks like it's his. Tony Marsden, is who we think he is. But from what I've heard, there's not much of a paper trail around his name. No records, very little to find out.
Do you: 
Ask if any other DNA was found?
Ask if anything else was found at the scene?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"We found someone else's blood at the scene, on a torch that had been dropped. Wasn't very bright of them" <voice name="Geraint">"So maybe in a bit of a panic." Haynes says. [Kathryn]"Maybe. I don't know, if they brought a shotgun they must have been surely expecting it?"</voice></voice> Kathryn replies.
Do you: 
Ask if there's anything else?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"No, I think that's it. The report will be done in an hour or so, I'll let you know if anything changes." <voice name="Geraint">"Thanks for this." You reply, leaving the room with Haynes. <voice name="Geraint">"We should go back and get the walker, right?"</voice></voice></voice> You think it over.
Do you: 
Agree, go back and interrogate the lone walker?
Disagree - but go to find the lone young man?
</speak>
<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Yes, I agree. Let's go ask him a few more questions"</voice>. You walk out of the police station.</speak>
<speak><voice name="Geraint">"I don't know, I'm just not seeing it. But let's go find him anyway, as well as the man in a hurry."</voice> You both leave the station.</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"We found a torch, along with blood which we haven't been able to match with the victim. <voice name="Geraint">"So maybe in a bit of a panic." Haynes says. [Kathryn]"Maybe. I don't know, if they brought a shotgun they must have been surely expecting it?"</voice></voice> Kathryn replies. 
Do you: 
Ask if there's anything else?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Yes, well that was pretty clear. He was shot in the back with a shotgun. He would have died within minutes."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask for the time of death?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Er, no. No, I don't remember seeing anybody."</voice>
Do you: 
End the interview?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Haynes, look round the side, is there anyone in there?"</voice>. You try to see through the glass.
Do you: 
Ring the doorbell again?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Could be - but I didn't see any tracks leading away." Haynes says. [Haynes]"Well, I didn't see ours either, between the mud and the dark." You reply. You look at the whiteboard. It's not exactly full. <voice name="Geraint">"Well, let's see where we are after interviewing the neighbours. Time?"[Haynes] "6:45". [Player]"Ok, give it a few hours, then we'll head out."</voice></voice>
Do you: 
Wait for a few hours?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Well, maybe? I don't know if it would've definitely killed him." Karl says. The others are arriving now. You need to head back to the station with Haynes. <voice name="Geraint">"Come on, let forensics do their job"</voice></voice>, you say to him
Do you: 
Head back to the car?
</speak>

<speak>You move the torch around the body, finding nothing - except for when a silver object flashes back. It's a torch on the ground. <voice name="Geraint">"This yours?" You ask both men. They shake their heads. [Player]"Ok, well we won't touch it."</voice>You can see behind you more officers arriving.
Do you: 
Ask for any other remarks?
Ask if he could have fallen?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"I don't know, except for that I found him 20 minutes ago now. I heard some noise earlier. Well, actually I heard a few noises, more like bangs, but I was tired - so can't remember exactly. I walk out, see someone outside, so I follow them. They don't move much, and that's when I realise this guy wasn't alive. I haven't touched him or anything - just called the police."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask to look at the body?
Search around the body?
</speak>

<speak><voice name="Geraint">"Oh, er, Karl Smith. I live locally, I don't have any official business here. I just like to watch over the green."</voice>
Do you: 
Ask to look at the body?
Search around the body?
</speak>
